item.text: Became Public Law No: 110-441.
Became Public Law No: 110-441.
Signed by President.
Signed by President.
Presented to President.
Presented to President.
Message on Senate action sent to the House.
Cleared for White House.
Passed Senate without amendment by Unanimous Consent. (consideration: CR S10421)
Passed/agreed to in Senate: Passed Senate without amendment by Unanimous Consent.(consideration: CR S10421)
Received in the Senate, read twice.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote. (text: CR 9/27/2008 H10142)
Passed/agreed to in House: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.(text: CR 9/27/2008 H10142)
Considered as unfinished business. (consideration: CR H10631)

At the conclusion of debate, the chair put the question on the motion to suspend the rules. Mr. Duncan objected to the vote on the grounds that a quorum was not present. Further proceedings on the motion were postponed. The point of no quorum was withdrawn.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 4131.
Considered under suspension of the rules. (consideration: CR H10142-10145)
Ms. Richardson moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill.
Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 282.
Reported by the Committee on Transportation. H. Rept. 110-895.
Reported by the Committee on Transportation. H. Rept. 110-895.
Ordered to be Reported by Voice Vote.
Committee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.
Subcommittee on Highways and Transit Discharged.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Highways and Transit.
Referred to the House Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure.
Introduced in House
Introduced in House

item.fullName: Del. Faleomavaega, Eni F. H. [D-AS-At Large]

item.title: H.R. 4131, A bill to designate a portion of California State Route 91 located in Los Angeles County, California, as the "Juanita Millender-McDonald Highway"
item.description: Cost estimate for the bill as ordered reported by the House Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure on July 31, 2008

item.title: H.R. 4131, A bill to designate a portion of California State Route 91 located in Los Angeles County, California, as the "Juanita Millender-McDonald Highway"
item.description: Cost estimate for the bill as ordered reported by the House Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure on July 31, 2008

summary.text: Designates the portion of California State Route 91 located in Los Angeles County, California, from post mile 10.4 to post mile 11.1 as the "Juanita Millender-McDonald Highway."

(This measure has not been amended since it was introduced. The summary of that version is repeated here.)

Designates the portion of California State Route 91 located in Los Angeles County, California, from post mile 10.4 to post mile 11.1 as the "Juanita Millender-McDonald Highway."

(This measure has not been amended since it was introduced. The summary of that version is repeated here.)

(This measure has not been amended since it was introduced. The summary of that version is repeated here.)

Designates the portion of California State Route 91 located in Los Angeles County, California, from post mile 10.4 to post mile 11.1 as the "Juanita Millender-McDonald Highway."

(This measure has not been amended since it was introduced. The summary of that version is repeated here.)

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
